intro: Acleisanthes lanceolata var. megaphylla, commonly known as the large-leaf sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and thrives in full sun. Its flowers are usually pink to purple in color and bloom during the spring and summer months. It is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
